review_title: MPTC is a great place to work
job_title: IT Manager in Fond du Lac, WI
pros: I love supporting student success. The college has great benefits which includes a work/life balance initiative. I work with awesome people across all departments.
cons: The college is in the process of developing career advancement paths but is not quite there yet.

review_title: Excellent work place. The company takes care of all employees.
job_title: Software Asset Aide in Fond du Lac, WI
cons: Part time jobs don't have the same benefits as the full time jobs.

job_title: Vice President in Fond du Lac, WI
pros:
Great people
positive culture
supports students
supports employees
Great mission
cons:
Challenging budgets
hard to keep up with the changing technology

review_title: The best place I have ever worked!  Great work environment.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Fond du Lac, WI
pros: In the last 15 years I have worked for 7 different employers in 2 different states and I can honestly say Moraine Park was the best place I have ever worked. The employees are the nicest and most caring people I have ever worked with.  The Benefits are excellent.  The salary and hours are good also.  The campuses have a small town feel that is very safe and caring.  You get to know the instructors, staff, and students.  I worked at Moraine Park in 2005 and got to visit all 3 campuses.
cons: Nothing I can think of.  If you don't like a small campus with a small town feel you might not like it.

job_title: Associate Dean in Fond du Lac, WI
pros: The college provides flexibility for some employees and permits open campus for faculty. Management and support staff who work through summer months are off on Fridays during the months of June and July.
cons: Faculty salary structure is determined based upon industry and varies depending upon area. The practice creates inconsistency and inequalities. Compensation is not the only area of concern. Work assignments are inconsistent among individuals with the same job title. Internal candidates are frequently overlooked for promotion.

review_title: Not bad, as far as tech schools go
job_title: Faculty Member in Fond du Lac, WI
pros:
Good people to work with
Lots of schedule flexibility
No micro-management
cons:
Hard to get a read on people and situations here
No real shots at promotion unless you're favored by the higher-ups
Feels like management makes decisions based on faulty logic
Pay is lower than other tech schools in the state
The three campuses make instruction more difficult (hard to teach through teleconference--sometimes the IVC fails)

job_title: Associate Dean of Nursing in West Bend, WI
pros: The college staff and employee's go above and beyond to ensure students are successful and meet their educational goals. The nursing program is strong with an NCLEX pass rate nationally of 97%.
cons: None.  The College is committed to student success to build strong communities and a strong workforce across Wisconsin.

job_title: Student Services Representative in Beaver Dam, WI
pros:
Established Tech College.
Great Pay
On the job training
Community involvement
cons: I was working in Student Services, which students don't use as much anymore. They do a lot of their registration, etc., online. Not much foot traffic in the office.

pros: I thoroughly enjoyed my role as a part-time instructor.  The job was rewarding and the pay was fair.
cons: Unnecessary meetings, occasional IT related issues not always resolved promptly

pros:

pros: great hours, friendly people, college atmosphere, great training, good environment
cons: low pay, travel accommodations lacking, no advancement, ok benefits, travel time
